Package models.kenken

Class Group

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.kenken.Group
  • public class Group
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a group of cells in the KenKen puzzle

      • addCell

        public void addCell​(Cell cell)
             throws exceptions.TooManyOperandsException,
                    exceptions.CellAlreadyInGroupException
        Adds a cell to the group
        Parameters:
        cell - , cell to be added to the group
        Throws:
        exceptions.TooManyOperandsException - when the operation accepts a limited number of operands/cells (OperationDivision, OperationEquality, OperationPower, OperationSubtraction)
        exceptions.CellAlreadyInGroupException - when the cell is already part of a group

        Parameters:
        cell - to check
        Returns:
        true if group contains the cell, false otherwise

      • cellsAreAdjacent

        public boolean cellsAreAdjacent()
        Checks if all the cells on the group are next to each other in order to fulfill the KenKen rules
        Returns:
        true if all the cells on the group are adjacent, false otherwise

      • getNotation

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(int value,
                           int size)
        Checks if a value, along with the non-empty cells of the group, is valid to reach the target of the current group
        Parameters:
        value - to be checked along with the other operands of the group
        size - , size of KenKen to determine maximum value that can be written
        Returns:
        true if the value fits the KenKen and Group conditions

      • check

        public boolean check()
              throws exceptions.OperandsDoNotMatchException,
                     exceptions.NonIntegerResultException
        Checks if the group is not empty, and then if all the values fulfill its target
        Returns:
        true if all the cells of the current group are not empty and fulfill the operation target
        Throws:
        exceptions.OperandsDoNotMatchException - when the operation get more operands than needed (Used for Operations with Limited Operands)
        exceptions.NonIntegerResultException - when the result or the operation is negative
